intro: Byrsonima nana, commonly known as dwarf soursop, is a small shrub native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its palmate leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces a fruit that is similar in appearance to the soursop but is smaller and less commonly cultivated. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often found in secondary forests and disturbed habitats. The plant has traditional uses in local medicine for its potential health benefits.
